item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Disbelief in magic can force a poor soul into believing in government and business." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "We waste time looking for the perfect lover, instead of creating the perfect love." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "A sense of humor...is superior to any religion so far devised." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "People tend the take everything too seriously. Especially themselves. Yep. And that's probably what makes 'em scared and hurt so much of the time. Life is too serious to take that seriously." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life, and see if I could not learn what it had to teach, and not, when I came to die, discover that I had not lived. I did not wish to live what was not life, living is so dear; nor did I wish to practise resignation, unless it was quite necessary. I wanted to live deep and suck out all the marrow of life, to live so sturdily and Spartan-like as to put to rout all that was not life, to cut a broad swath and shave close, to drive life into a corner, and reduce it to its lowest terms." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music he hears, however measured or far away." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Any fool can make a rule And any fool will mind it." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "A man is rich in proportion to the number of things which he can afford to let alone." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I say, beware of all enterprises that require new clothes, and not rather a new wearer of clothes." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I would rather sit on a pumpkin, and have it all to myself, than be crowded on a velvet cushion." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "How many a man has dated a new era in his life from the reading of a book." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself." -- mark twain

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Benjamin Disraeli
item.description: "There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics." -- Benjamin Disraeli

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you don't read the newspaper, you're uninformed. If you read the newspaper, you're mis-informed." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I wanted all things To seem to make some sense, So we could all be happy, yes, Instead of tense. And I made up lies So that they all fit nice, And I made this sad world A par-a-dise." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
Jonathan add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Charm was a scheme for making strangers like and trust a person immediately, no matter what the charmer had in mind." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "When the going gets weird, the weird turn professional." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "The human brain is a complex organ with the wonderful power of enabling man to find reasons for continuing to believe whatever it is that he wants to believe." -- Voltaire

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Don't feel sorry for yourself. Only assholes do that." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Calvin Trillin
item.description: "The most remarkable thing about my mother is that for thirty years she served the family nothing but leftovers. The original meal has never been found." -- Calvin Trillin

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Calvin Trillin
item.description: "When someone reaches middle age, people he knows begin to get put in charge of things, and knowing what he knows about the people who are being put in charge of things scares the hell out of him." -- Calvin Trillin

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "If it is ones lot to be cast among fools, one must learn foolishness.-The Count of Monte Cristo" -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Jonathan add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Self-esteem is for sissies. Accept that you're a pimple and try to keep a lively sense of humor about it. That way lies grace - and maybe even glory." -- Tom Robbins
